newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.03 down at 41.28 to the dollar on Thursday as demand for the U.S. currency rose after Tuesday's downward adjustment of rupee by the central bank, dealer said.
"The rupee may remain under pressure for a few more sessions," one dealer said.

The State Bank (central) Bank of Pakistan adjusted the rupee on May 6 to 40.3300/40.5317 to the dollar from 40.2400/40.4412 fixed on April 23. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 2.30 percent compared to Wednesday's close at 2.35 percent. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
